instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot Loop
threads.message: Hi all, I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on my bench that's bootlooping. Tried without the trackpad connected, same issue. It will sit on the boot options screen forever without freezing or rebooting but if I select the internal drive's OS or an external drive with an OS it will show the Apple logo then after a few moments the power drops down to 0.00 amps and it reboots and chimes again. Trying to go into recovery does the same. Any ideas where to start on this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot Loop
threads.message: This should be solved with DFU, did you try it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot Loop
threads.message: I have not yet, will try that and report back!
